channel.title: Unofficial MBTA Alert Feed
channel.description: An unofficial feed for public transit alerts in the Boston area.

item.title: CT3, 8 and 47 notice: The stop at 88 E Newton St has closed for construction. Passengers can use the stop at Harrison Ave @ E Newton St.

description.pre: CT3, 8 and 47 notice: The stop at 88 E Newton St has closed for construction. Passengers can use the stop at Harrison Ave @ E Newton St.

item.title: The Ring Rd @ Boylston St stop has moved down Ring Road, away from Boylston Street, due to construction until further notice.

description.pre:
The Ring Rd @ Boylston St stop has moved down Ring Road, away from Boylston Street, due to construction until further notice.
Affected routes: 9 39

item.title: Winthrop Ferry service has been extended until November 30.

description.pre: Winthrop Ferry service has been extended until November 30.

item.title: Maverick Elevator 966 (Platform to Lewis Courtyard) unavailable due to maintenance

description.pre:
Maverick Elevator 966 (Platform to Lewis Courtyard) unavailable due to maintenance
To exit, use Maverick Elevator 965 located at the opposite end of the platform to access Maverick Sq. To board, travel northeast along the pedestrian mall towards Maverick Sq, then cross Sumner St to the main Maverick entrance and use Maverick Elevator 965.

item.title: Speed restrictions of 10 - 25 miles per hour are in place in some areas on the Red Line while track repairs are made.

description.pre: Speed restrictions of 10 - 25 miles per hour are in place in some areas on the Red Line while track repairs are made.

item.title: Worcester Line Train 532 (6:35 pm from Worcester) is operating 5-15 minutes behind schedule between Wellesley Farms and South Station.

description.pre:
Worcester Line Train 532 (6:35 pm from Worcester) is operating 5-15 minutes behind schedule between Wellesley Farms and South Station.
Affected direction: Inbound

description.pre: Andrew Escalator 124 (Ashmont/Braintree platform to busway) unavailable due to maintenance

item.title: Summer St @ Drydock Ave is now the new last stop on the Route 4 inbound and the first stop on the Route 4 outbound.

description.pre: Summer St @ Drydock Ave is now the new last stop on the Route 4 inbound and the first stop on the Route 4 outbound.

item.title: The Rt. 128 Garage is undergoing repairs & renovations. Level 1 is closed to parking & can be used for pick up & drop off only. Level 2 - 4

description.pre: The Route 128 Garage is undergoing repairs and renovations. Level 1 is currently closed to parking and can be used for pick up and drop off only. Level 2 - 4 access is available only from University Ave.

item.title: Rt. 450 IB trips departing Salem at 10:25pm & 11:25pm on Fridays will use the Ted Williams Tunnel to get to Haymarket Sta.

description.pre: Route 450 inbound trips departing Salem at 10:25 PM and 11:25 PM on Fridays will use the Ted Williams Tunnel to get to Haymarket Station. This detour is necessary due to the weekend closure of the Sumner Tunnel for MassDOT maintenance.

item.title: Terminal B Stop 2 - Arrivals Level: This Bus Stop has been moved to the right of door B110 upon exiting the terminal.

description.pre:
Terminal B Stop 2 - Arrivals Level: This Bus Stop has been moved to the right of door B110 upon exiting the terminal.
Affected routes: Silver Line - SL1 171

item.title: The following stop has closed due to construction: N Harvard St @ Western Ave. This stop has moved to nearside of S Campus Dr.

description.pre:
The following stop has closed due to construction: N Harvard St @ Western Ave. This stop has moved to nearside of S Campus Dr.

description.pre:
The following stops are closed on Thu Nov 30 due to construction: Prospect St @ Bishop Allen Dr and Prospect St @ Bishop Allen Dr

item.title: Rt. 90 stop: Outb. stop Cross St @ Otis St has now been shifted within the same block to become Cross St @ Bonair St. This change was made t

description.pre:
Route 90 stop notice: Outbound stop Cross St @ Otis St has now been shifted within the same block to become Cross St @ Bonair St. This change was made to accommodate school pick up and drop off.
Affected stops: Cross St @ Otis St (outbound)

item.title: On Tues, Dec 5, buses will replace Trains 280 & 200 for service between Haverhill & Andover. Trains will operate as intended between Andover

description.pre:
On Tues, December 5, buses will replace Trains 280 (4:51 am from Lawrence) & 200 (5:27 am from Haverhill) for service between Haverhill & Andover. Trains will operate as intended between Andover & North Station but may experience delays up to 20 minutes.
The bus will operate on a regular train schedule but expect a delay up to 20 minutes.
Affected direction: Inbound

item.title: As of on weekdays from 9am - 3:15pm, now through Nov 17th, boarding will occur from the tracks adjacent to the 45 Shrewsbury St parking lot

description.pre:
Effective on weekdays from 9:00 am - 3:15 pm, now through December 21st, at Worcester Station, boarding will occur from the tracks adjacent to the 45 Shrewsbury Street parking lot.
The parking lot on Shrewsbury Street has limited parking spots due to the ongoing construction.

item.title: As of on Aug 26th & through Fall 2023, parking won't be available at Ashland during the temporary station closure.

description.pre:
Parking is not available at Ashland during the temporary station closure. Passengers who wish to park should travel to Southborough or Framingham through Fall.
Ashland station is closed to allow for critical improvement work. A free shuttle bus service is provided between Ashland and Framingham to connect with the regular Worcester Line train service.

item.title: As of on Aug 26th & through Fall 2023, Ashland station will be closed to allow for critical improvement work. A free shuttle bus service wil

description.pre:
Ashland station will re-open on Saturday, December 23rd as the critical improvement work is concluding. A free shuttle bus operates between Ashland and Framingham to connect with Worcester Line trains through Friday, December 22nd.
Buses pick up passengers on the Track 2/inbound side at Ashland.

item.title: On Mon, Dec 4, from 7:30pm until closing, buses will replace regular train service between Andover & Haverhill to allow for work on a pedest

description.pre:
On Mon, December 4, from 7:30 pm through the end of service, buses will replace regular train service between Andover & Haverhill to allow for work on a pedestrian bridge in Lawrence. The bus will operate on trains' schedules. Expect longer journey times.
Affected trips: 221 (7:30 pm from North Station) 224 (9:15 pm from Haverhill) 223 (9:40 pm from North Station) 225 (11:40 pm from North Station)

item.title: The Alewife Garage may have additional spaces taken to accelerate repairs while the demand for parking is low.

description.pre: The Alewife Garage may have additional spaces taken to accelerate repairs while the demand for parking is low. Once parking demand increases, these spaces will be made available again to our riders.

description.pre:
Massachusetts Avenue Elevator 852 (Platform to paid lobby) unavailable on Sun Dec 10 due to maintenance
A shuttle bus will be available to transport customers between Massachusetts Avenue and Back Bay. To exit, exit the train at Back Bay and find station personnel or use a station call box to request the shuttle bus to Massachusetts Avenue. To board, find station personnel or use a station call box at Massachusetts Avenue to request the shuttle bus to Back Bay.

item.title: Chinatown Elevator 922 (Forest Hills platform to Boylston St, Washington St) unavailable due to maintenance

description.pre:
Chinatown Elevator 922 (Forest Hills platform to Boylston St, Washington St) unavailable due to maintenance
To exit, exit the train at Tufts Mediical Center, and use Silver Line SL4 or SL5 bus to Chinatown. To board, proceed to the Silver Line SL5 bus stop at Washington St and Essex St, and take an SL5 (Downtown) bus to Tufts Medical Center (stay on bus past the Temple Pl stop). Alternatively, if possible, travel 0.2 miles south on Washington St to Tufts Medical Center.

item.title: The Braintree Parking Garage has re-opened with most parking spots available. The surface lot on Ivory St will remain open as an alternate.

description.pre:
The Braintree Parking Garage has re-opened with most parking spots available. The surface lot on Ivory St will remain open as an alternate parking option.
Riders can continue to use PayByPhone or pay-by-plate with the same parking fees as other MBTA surface lots.
Affected routes: Red Line

item.title: Lynn Parking Garage arcade stairs 1 & 2 are closed until further notice. Customers may exit the garage via elevators to the ground level or

description.pre:
Lynn Parking Garage arcade stairs 1 and 2 are closed until further notice due to structural issues. Customers may exit the garage via elevators to the ground level or by using the south stairs located on the Market street side of the garage.
Vehicular access to the upper 2 levels of the garage is restricted. The garage has sufficient parking capacity to accommodate daily demand.

item.title: Commuter Rail service returns to Lynn on Dec 18 with the opening of Lynn Interim Sta. The inb. platform is located on Ellis St. The outb

description.pre: Commuter Rail service returns to Lynn on December 18 with the opening of Lynn Interim Station. The inbound platform is located on Ellis Street. The outbound platform is located on Friend Street.

item.title: The Upper Parking Lot at Worcester Station is closed with the exception to accessible parking, due to construction.

description.pre: The Upper Parking Lot at Worcester Station is closed with the exception to accessible parking, due to construction.

item.title: The Quincy Adams parking garage has re-opened with most parking spaces available.

description.pre:
The Quincy Adams parking garage has re-opened with most parking spaces available. Customers can access the garage via the Route 3 off ramp exit as well as the Burgin Parkway entrance.
Beginning November 29, the parking lot across from the station will close. Please use the garage or adjacent surface lot as an alternative.
The Quincy Adams Garage drop-off and pick-up location will remain at its location within Level 1B.
The garage will be PayByPhone / PayByPlate with no need to pay to exit. More information on how to pay for parking is available at mbta.com/parking.
Affected routes: Red Line

item.title: the Alewife West Pedal & Park is closed until further notice. Use the Central or East instead.

description.pre: Due to garage construction, the Alewife West Pedal & Park is closed until further notice. Please use the Central or East Pedal & Parks instead. Contact pedalpark@mbta.com with questions

item.title: Green Line Trains will bypass Haymarket Sta in both directions from Dec 6 - 16 to allow for work on the Government Center Garage demolition

description.pre:
Green Line Trains will bypass Haymarket Station in both directions from December 6 - 16 to allow for work on the Government Center Garage demolition.
Affected lines: Green Line B branch Green Line C branch Green Line D branch Green Line E branch

item.title: Green Ln service suspended between Lechmere & Kenmore, Dec 4 - 5, for maintenance work. Use shuttles and Orange Line for service

description.pre:
Green Line service will be suspended from Lechmere to Babcock St, Kenmore, and Heath St, Dec 4 -5 for maintenance work. Use Buses for service to Back Bay, Orange Line for service downtown, and Buses from N. Station to Lechmere.
An accessible van is available for any customers who need it between Kenmore and North Station. To request van service or need help locating nearby Orange Line stations, please see station personnel or use a station call box.
Commuter rail will offer free fares between South Station, Back Bay, and Lansdowne.
Affected stops: North Station (Transfer within Station to Orange Line Service.) Haymarket (Station will be closed. Transfer to Orange Line service at State or North Station.) Government Center (use State, 0.2 mi.) Park Street (use Downtown Crossing, 0.2 mi.) Boylston (use Chinatown, 0.1 mi.) Arlington (use Chinatown, 0.4 mi.) Copley (use Back Bay, 0.2 mi.) Prudential (use Mass Ave 0.4 mi.) Symphony (use Mass Ave 0.1 mi.) Northeastern University (use Ruggles 0.3 mi) Museum of Fine Arts (use Ruggles 0.3 mi) Longwood Medical Area Brigham Circle Fenwood Road Mission Park Riverway Back of the Hill Heath Street Kenmore Blandford Street - Not serviced by shuttle buses Boston University East Boston University Central Amory Street Babcock Street

item.title: The two outer lanes at the Quincy Adams Garage toll plaza over Centre St are closed until further notice.

description.pre: The two outer lanes at the Quincy Adams Garage toll plaza over Centre St are closed until further notice. Repairing the bridge is part of the South Shore Garage Project. More: https://www.mbta.com/south-shore-garages

item.title: Commuter Rail service at S Attleboro is temporarily suspended due to significant deterioration of the pedestrian overpass.

description.pre:
Commuter Rail service at South Attleboro is temporarily suspended due to significant deterioration of the pedestrian overpass. Service will resume & the pedestrian overpass will reopen when the station Accessibility Improvement Project is fully completed.
Local GATRA and RIPTA bus service at the station will not be impacted. Riders may also consider Attleboro Station as a temporary alternative.

The following stop will be permanently closed starting Sunday December 17: Main St opp Olcott St

item.title: Green Ln will be suspended from N Station to Babcock St, Kenmore, & Heath St, from Nov 27 - Dec 3. Use Buses and Orange Line for service.

description.pre:
Green Line service will be suspended from North Station to Babcock St, Kenmore, and Heath St, from Nov 27 - Dec 3. Use Buses for service to Back Bay, and Orange Line for service downtown. Suspension will be extended from N. Station to Lechmere Dec. 4-5.
An accessible van is available for any customers who need it between Kenmore and North Station. To request van service or need help locating nearby Orange Line stations, please see station personnel or use a station call box.
Commuter rail will offer free fares between South Station, Back Bay, and Lansdowne.
Affected stops: North Station (Transfer within Station to Orange Line Service.) Haymarket (Station will be closed. Transfer to Orange Line service at State or North Station.) Government Center (use State, 0.2 mi.) Park Street (use Downtown Crossing, 0.2 mi.) Boylston (use Chinatown, 0.1 mi.) Arlington (use Chinatown, 0.4 mi.) Copley (use Back Bay, 0.2 mi.) - Shuttle buses located at St James Ave @ Trinity Place Prudential (use Mass Ave 0.4 mi.) Symphony (use Mass Ave 0.1 mi.) Northeastern University (use Ruggles 0.3 mi) Museum of Fine Arts (use Ruggles 0.3 mi) Longwood Medical Area Brigham Circle Fenwood Road Mission Park Riverway Back of the Hill Heath Street Kenmore Blandford Street - Not serviced by shuttle buses Boston University East Boston University Central Amory Street Babcock Street

item.title: Buses will replace regular train service between Swampscott & N Station from Sat, Dec 2nd through Sun, Dec 10th.

description.pre:
Buses will replace regular train service between Swampscott and North Station from Saturday, December 2nd through Sunday, December 10th to allow for signal improvement work. There will be no service at Chelsea and River Works.
-Train service will operate between Newburyport/Rockport and Swampscott.
-Passengers at Chelsea may consider boarding Silver Line #3 for service to/from Boston
-A diversion schedule will be in effect. the schedule is now available on MBTA.com.
-The normal shuttle bus schedule between Lynn & Swampscott will be suspended as the diversion will include bus service to Lynn.
-Buses will be accessible but bikes won't be allowed on board.
-Buses will be free but passengers are expected to purchase regular fares for travel between Swampscott & their station of origin/destination.
-Normal train service will resume on Monday, December 11.

item.title: Rt. 712 detoured due to construction daily from 2 pm to 11 pm. Inb.: connect at Revere St @ Golden Dr & Crest Ave @ Grovers Ave. Outb.: conn

description.pre:
Route 712 detoured due to construction daily from 2 pm to 11 pm. Inbound: connections can be made at Revere St @ Golden Dr and Crest Ave @ Grovers Ave. Outbound: connections can be made at Revere St @ Hutchinson St and Crest Ave @ Grovers Ave.
Affected stops: Crest Ave @ Revere St (outbound) Crest Ave @ Highland Ave (inbound)

item.title: Route 47 experiencing delays of up to 25 minutes due to traffic

description.pre: Route 47 experiencing delays of up to 25 minutes due to traffic

item.title: Green Line D Branch: Shuttle buses replace service between Riverside and Kenmore from December 11-20 for track work.

description.pre:
Green Line D Branch: Shuttle buses replace service between Riverside and Kenmore from December 11-20 for track work.
All shuttle buses are accessible for persons with disabilities. Shuttle buses will stop at all D Branch stations, except for Beaconsfield. Below are some additional alternate travel options that D Branch riders may consider.
Alternate Travel Options via Green Line and Bus: Reservoir - C Branch stop at Cleveland Circle, about a 5 minute walk Beaconsfield - C Branch stop at Dean Road, about a 4 minute walk Brookline Hills - Route 60 service, which is available at the intersection of Route 9 and Cypress St, about a 4 minute walk Brookline Village - E Branch at Riverway, about a 7 minute walk. Additionally, bus routes 60, 65, and 66 are available at Washington St @ Walnut St, about a 5 minute walk. Longwood - C Branch stop Kent Street, about a 9 minute walk. Fenway - C Branch stop Saint Mary's Street, about a 5 minute walk
Alternate Travel Options via Commuter Rail: Riders who would typically board at Riverside and Woodland may consider the Auburndale and West Newton stops on the Framingham/Worcester Line for service to Lansdowne, Back Bay, and South Station. Lansdowne is about a 7 minute walk from Kenmore and about a 15 minute walk from the Longwood Medical Area. Bus routes 8, 19, 60, and 65 are available on Brookline Ave which is about a 1 minute walk from Lansdowne. These routes serve the Longwood Medical Area and Kenmore.
No Shuttles at Beaconsfield: Why do shuttles skip Beaconsfield? Due to narrow roads near Beaconsfield, shuttles cannot safely stop there. We recommend taking the Green Line C Branch from Dean Road, about a 4 minute walk.
Affected stops: Kenmore Fenway Longwood Brookline Village Brookline Hills Beaconsfield Reservoir Chestnut Hill Newton Centre Newton Highlands Eliot Waban Woodland Riverside

item.title: On weekdays, now through Nov, 8 am - 4 pm, Fitch Ln passengers may experience delays up to 20 minutes both ways due to fiber optic work

description.pre:
On weekdays, now through December, 8 am - 4 pm, Fitchburg Line passengers may experience delays up to 20 minutes in both directions due to fiber optic implementation work as part of the Commuter Rail Safety and Resiliency Program.

Affected trips: 406 (7:25 am from Wachusett) 408 (8:25 am from Wachusett) 410 (9:25 am from Wachusett) 412 (10:25 am from Wachusett) 414 (11:25 am from Wachusett) 416 (1:01 pm from Littleton/Route 495) 418 (1:25 pm from Wachusett) 420 (3:01 pm from Littleton/Route 495)

item.title: As of on Mon, Feb 13th, & through the end of 2023, the entrances to Natick Center station will be relocated to Washington St.

description.pre:
Effective through the end of 2023, the entrances to Natick Center station will be relocated to Washington Street for access to the inbound and outbound platforms.
North Avenue entrance and Walnut Street entrance will remain closed until further notice.
This access change will allow for work on the new platforms as part of Natick Center Station Accessibility Improvements Project.

item.title: Shuttle buses replace Green Ln between N Station & Medford / Tufts, from 8:45pm to end of service, Nov 27 through Dec 10 for track work.

description.pre:
Shuttle buses replace Green Line service between North Station and Medford / Tufts from 8:45 PM to end of service, Nov 27 - Dec 10, for track work. Union Square riders should use Bus routes 86, 87, or 91 to connect to shuttles or Orange line.
Affected stops: Medford/Tufts Ball Square Magoun Square Gilman Square East Somerville Lechmere Science Park/West End North Station Union Square (No shuttle service to Union. Use Bus routes 86, 87, or 91)

item.title: Beginning Fri Oct 20th Rt. 80, 87, & 88 inb. stop McGrath Hwy @ Twin City Plaza will be shifted further east on Mass. Rt

description.pre:
Beginning Friday Oct 20th Route 80, 87, and 88 inbound stop McGrath Hwy @ Twin City Plaza will be shifted further east on Mass. Route 28 to a new floating island bus stop near Rufo Rd.
Affected routes: 80 87 88

item.title: Oak Grove Elevator 800 (Busway, Commuter Rail, parking lot to lobby) unavailable due to maintenance

description.pre:
Oak Grove Elevator 800 (Busway, Commuter Rail, parking lot to lobby) unavailable due to maintenance
To exit, upon exiting the faregates, turn left and proceed to Oak Grove Elevator 745 to access the busway and parking lot. To board, proceed to the station entrance located near the busway and use Oak Grove Elevator 745 to access the lobby. Alternatively, customers may utilize Oak Grove Elevator 744 (Lobby to Washington St.) located at the station entrance on Washington St.

item.title: No train service at River Works station from Saturday, December 2nd through Sunday, December 10th to allow for signal improvement work.

description.pre:
No train service at River Works station from Saturday, December 2nd through Sunday, December 10th to allow for signal improvement work.
Affected stops: River Works

description.pre:

item.title: On the weekend of Dec 2-3, all Haverhill Ln trains will bypass Malden Center to allow for platform improvement work.

description.pre:
On the weekend of December 2-3, all Haverhill Line trains will bypass Malden Center to allow for platform improvement work. Regular train service will operate on the rest of the line. Please consider the Orange Line for service to and from Boston.
Affected stops: Malden Center
Affected trips: 2200 (5:35 am from Haverhill) 1200 (5:35 am from Haverhill) 2201 (7:00 am from North Station) 1201 (7:00 am from North Station) 2202 (8:35 am from Haverhill) 1202 (8:35 am from Haverhill) 2203 (9:00 am from North Station) 1203 (9:00 am from North Station) 2204 (10:50 am from Haverhill) 1204 (10:50 am from Haverhill) 2205 (11:15 am from North Station) 1205 (11:15 am from North Station) 2206 (12:50 pm from Haverhill) 1206 (12:50 pm from Haverhill) 2207 (1:15 pm from North Station) 1207 (1:15 pm from North Station) 2208 (2:50 pm from Haverhill) 1208 (2:50 pm from Haverhill) 2209 (3:15 pm from North Station) 1209 (3:15 pm from North Station) 2210 (4:50 pm from Haverhill) 1210 (4:50 pm from Haverhill) 2211 (5:15 pm from North Station) 1211 (5:15 pm from North Station) 2212 (6:50 pm from Haverhill) 1212 (6:50 pm from Haverhill) 2213 (8:15 pm from North Station) 1213 (8:15 pm from North Station) 2214 (9:50 pm from Haverhill) 1214 (9:50 pm from Haverhill) 2215 (11:30 pm from North Station) 1215 (11:30 pm from North Station)

item.title: Bowdoin Escalator 125 (Lobby to street) is unavailable until further notice.

description.pre:
Bowdoin Escalator 125 (Lobby to street) is unavailable until further notice pending replacement.
The escalator will remain out of service for the foreseeable future. This decision was made after a thorough inspection determined that corrosion on the escalatorâ€™s steel truss was so severe that it could not be repaired further and that a complete replacement of the escalator would be required. Replacing the escalator at this location requires a more extended unit meeting modern escalator safety requirements. This longer unit will require significant alteration to the station entrance to meet code requirements. The MBTA has currently begun design work to understand what station upgrades will be needed.
Due to these complexities, we expect the escalator will remain out of service for a significant time. We recognize the challenges this poses to our riders, and please know we are working to identify a solution as quickly as possible. In the meantime, Government Center Station, which is fully accessible and serves the Blue Line, is under a quarter-mile from Bowdoin Station.

item.title: Stop Closure: Beginning Oct 11, Arsenal St opp Elm St will close permanently. Closest stops are Arsenal St opp Arlington St & 500 Arsenal St

description.pre:
Stop Closure: Beginning October 11, Arsenal St opp Elm St will close permanently. Closest stops are Arsenal St opp Arlington St and 500 Arsenal St.
Affected routes: 70

item.title: Orange Line Trains will bypass Haymarket Sta in both directions through Dec 16 to allow for work on the Government Center Garage demolition

description.pre:
Orange Line Trains will bypass Haymarket Station in both directions through December 16 to allow for work on the Government Center Garage demolition.
Affected lines: Orange Line

item.title: The Hancock St lot is closed to allow for the construction of the N Quincy Garage. Over 300 spaces are available in the Newport Ave Lot

description.pre:
The Hancock Street lot is closed to allow for the construction of the North Quincy Garage. As an alternative, over 300 spaces are available in the Newport Avenue lot.
Affected routes: Red Line

item.title: GLX Pedal & Park facilities are not yet operational. Please use the conventional bike racks at GLX Stations.

description.pre:
GLX Pedal & Park facilities are not yet operational. Please use conventional bike racks at GLX stations while we evaluate access control at these locations
Affected lines: Green Line B branch Green Line C branch Green Line D branch Green Line E branch 69 80 87 88
Affected stops: Medford/Tufts Ball Square Magoun Square Gilman Square East Somerville Lechmere
